answers.answer: The laboratory will use the vein draw.  There is a lag time between what is seen in the vein and what is seen in the capillary.147 is a bit high, but then 75g of glucose is quite a load.I would think that you are early days if you are tending towards diabetes and instead of worrying about these numbers you should focus on getting and staying healthy; lower carb diet, eating natural and unprocessed foods, daily exercise, weight normalization if you are overweight.

So are you saying the lab is the number to by not the meter?It is a bit high and my diet is super clean already and I'm actually 5 lbs underweight  so that Is even more to worry regarding numbers.especially since two hours lapsed.So which is the accurate number the vein draw, both were taken 3 minutes apart.Any additional clarification would help. Thank you
The BG meter has an error of 20% so the meter reading of 147 - (147*0.2) =117.6Could be ACTUALLY  117.6
1 test does NOT make a diagnosis.
Thanks I know it was my third.

question: I need help as to which number I should go by my dr has told me I'm fine.after an ogtt of 75 high gluclose drink my end 2 hour results were:Vein draw: 115 and meter : 147.I thought 147 was too high, which number do I use?Any help is appreciated
title: Ogtt results venous vs capillary which one is correct?
